column4: heya, hows the environment called that is used before X is loaded?
nah, not commandline, but the loadingscreen and stuff
do you know how to change the mode its running in? I keep getting "out of range" on my monitor untill X loads, then it works fine.

you can change it temporarily from when you boot, press 'e' when ubuntu is selected, find the line that starts with 'kernel', press 'e' again and edit the end (vga=792,791,etc.), then 'b' to boot (http://shrimpworks.za.net/2005/01/31/change-your-console-resolution-and-colour-depth/)
